reasoning: Apocrine breast carcinoma is a rare histological subtype of breast cancer, comprising 0.3-1% of all breast cancers. Global breast cancer incidence ~50 per 100k; apocrine type estimated as 0.3-0.5% = 0.15-0.25 per 100k. Limited epidemiological literature; estimate based on histopathology registries and cancer center case series. Uses incidence as primary metric.
source: Maluf HV et al. (2006). Apocrine carcinoma of the breast: clinical and pathological study of 25 cases. Arch Pathol Lab Med. 130(4):443-448
